website_summaries.verdict: The WD My Passport Portable makes an excellent portable drive for use with both desktop and laptop computers, at home or while on the road.
pros: The USB 3.0-based WD My Passport Portable offers top capacity and fast performance in a compact, good-looking, and sturdy package
It also comes with useful software, and it's relatively affordable
cons: The My Passport's included backup software doesn't allow you to back up on a schedule

customer_reviews.title: Don't count on it for backup
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive 3 years ago. I made a backup image of my laptop once at that time and put the drive away for safe keeping thinking I was all set in case of a laptop HD failure. Yesterday, I wanted to do another image backup of my laptop (second time use in 3 years) and the drive didn't show up in Device Manager on Windows 7. I spent hours Googling what could be wrong. Tried it on another laptop. Changed the cable. No joy. If you're counting on this drive for backup - you could be in for a big surprise.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Justin

customer_reviews.title: This drive now blocks my access to my data
customer_reviews.text: Bought this over five years ago. Set up the password with a clue. I also set up the drive so it would automatically log me in. Lo and behold, over five years later, the drive security app decides it wants me to log in with my password. My hint points to two possibilities. Neither of these possibilities work in their various forms. Apparently, WD says I have to wipe the drive clean, meaning they have no recovery process. I've lost all of my college projects, my ministry notes, as well as a lot of other data. Western Digital, I will never buy another product with your name.
customer_reviews.author: BlackhawkFan

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a while, left it in a closet now all my data is gone and hard drive dead
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased external hardrive to backup family photos, that is exactly what I did a few years ago and I placed this hard drive in my closet protected in a case. I just went to check on this and all my family photos are gone permanently, the hard drive is completely wiped and giving me errors when I connect it to my PC. This is absolutely devastating and makes no sense, I had usb drives and other much older storage devices like zip drives that still have their data intact.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: LOST SO MANY IMPORTANT PHOTOS AND VIDEOS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep family photos and videos since they were taking up too much space on my laptop. Recently plugged it in to put on some more but it bricked itself in the process and after searching through WD forums, it's apparently a very common problem. Tech support was useless and they denied the problem existing despite the forum post from 2016 having comments added over the years talking about the same issue. Not just worthless it took a lot of important photos with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy T.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 7 years
customer_reviews.text: It worked well until about a few months ago when it won't read anything. It is extreemely slow when it does. I can see some of my files, that are helplessly out of my reach since it's too slow to even access the files. I've tried updating firmware, but it seems WD gave up on supporting this product a while ago. It's a shame I lost a lot of memories because of this drive, mostly photos and videos of my youth. I highly do not recommend this item, and from what I've heard WD has a high incidence of failure in their drives. I went straight to Seagate for my recent purchase. I'm heartbroken at the loss of my memories.
customer_reviews.author: David Park

customer_reviews.title: Got ripped off
customer_reviews.text: I'm wirting this review way too late. THe disc was DOA. I tried formatting and stuff. I couldn't return it as I was out of the country. Then I figured I could try and get it repaired... When I brought it to the shop, they opened it in front of my eyes and it was a 500MB chinese ripoff. Kudos on their amazing ability to counterfeit this... Just thought I'd drop the note somewhere, it is too late for me, but it is just a warning this DD is being distributed as counterfeit...
customer_reviews.author: Leaonide Beaumont

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this new from Amazon back in 2013. Since I only used it for occasional file back up, in the 5 years I have owned it, I have used it maybe a total of 20 times. Well, I went to use it yesterday and after several hours of trouble shooting, concluded that it no longer works. I have never dropped it and I stored properly. If you want a more reliable external hard drive, you might want to look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: bookjunkie22

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: Shame on me for not opening this right away and checking it out. I needed it for a project and before it arrive, the project fell apart. I never opened it for several months after that purchase but kept it because I knew it would come in handy eventually. When I finally did open the package and hook up to the computer, it was a bad drive and impossible to boot up. If you do purchase this, try it immediately and ensure it is functional.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: This is HORRIBLE. I lost over two years of important files. It worked fine on my old Windows 7 PC. I wanted to use it with a newer Windows 10 PC and every time I connect it, it freezes the computer. I even tried downloading some new drive utilities from Western Digital. NO IMPROVEMENT. The only solution I can think of is to try opening this piece of crap on an old PC, transferring the files, and THROWING THIS USELESS BRICK IN THE GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: W. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Mine just failed after 5 years...
customer_reviews.text: I have always been careful with my drives. I just plugged the cable into my computer and all I got on the drive is click, click, click. I tried a different cable and a different computer with the same result. I am now talking to someone who might be able to recover the photos on the drive. Very disappointed with this WD My Passport hard drive!
customer_reviews.author: kcphotos

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: This one died after 4 years. I don't know if that's an average lifespan of this product or what, but I have two other external HDs that are older and are still good. And it's also making a lot of spinning noise. All of a sudden, maybe after High Sierra update, everything seems locked. It is recognized but the Finder shows only a couple of folders that aren't accessible and Disk Utility cannot erase or reformat it or anything. After much googling, I had to conclude this is corrupted.
customer_reviews.author: soo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent USB hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one from Amazon, but I have five of them now. I love them, although I can't give any better reason than they work well, are reasonably priced for the amount of storage, and very portable. I also bought a carrying case for this one, and I would suggest if you are moving it around AT ALL, to buy the carrying case. It is a small investment for the drive.
customer_reviews.author: LoveWorksDotComTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Worked great out of the box. Very small and light. Great for back-up storage.
customer_reviews.text: What else can I say besides they work, they're small and great for back-up storage. I'm a photographer and I trust Western Digital hard-drives for backing up both client images and personal images. I always duplicate my back-ups over multiple drives as well as online storage. Do you think that's overkill? I'd say it's better than losing someone's precious memories, or your own. Side note,: You should really print the most important images and frame them up or put them in a photo album. I'm just sayin', a print is nicer to look at than a screen image. It feels less disposable, if that makes sense?
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Four

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend these external USB drives
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these Western Digital external USB hard drives over the years (for Windows) -- I use them to back up my computer's main hard drive. I just wrote a DOS batch file to copy any files that have been updated from the C: drive to the WD external drive. I haven't had any trouble with any of them -- they all seem to work perfectly. Recently I did notice that the drives seem unhappy being connected to my laptop through a USB hub -- they would periodically go into autoplay mode. I instead connected the drives directly to the computer's USB port, and no more problems. I highly recommend these external USB drives.
customer_reviews.author: David Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Good Hard Drive - Lousy Backup software...!
customer_reviews.text: Good Product and use it almost daily.....However, the software supplied to auto back up the HD had many problems, both in use, understanding of the backup process and myriad of issues where the software lost track of the backup routine and became inoperable. Most of the time, the drive was hung up, lost communication, couldnt find the drive and even more connectivity issues. Eventually, I dumped the autobackup routine and am using it as a slave drive where I do the thinking and perform a manual backup.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this device in January of 2014 and backed up valuable files and information. We then decided recently to try to retrieve those files, and the device began to make a ticking noise. We contacted Western Digital and they confirmed that the device malfunctioned. $83 is a lot of money to pay for something that renders itself completely useless. Since others have had the same happen to them, we're at a loss at what to do or which brand to order next. Wish we'd ordered from Amazon rather than a third party seller. Amazon is much more accommodating in situations such as this.
customer_reviews.author: M&D

customer_reviews.title: Best of all drives
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my massive collection of camera recording that I love to shoot and some other data intensive stuff. All of my hard drives are western digital and have been using them last 20 years never had a single problem. This drive is no exception. Prior to my purchase I read some reviews stating that It's clicking, yes it's clicking and it actually making me nervous a whether there might be some fundamental problems with it. So I don't want to frustrate myself with that negative thought of "something might happen" because of the metallic clicky sound of the drive. I something happend I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: 3D Hype

customer_reviews.title: Can't decide how I feel... happy that it was magically revived after 5 years
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in August 2013, used it as backup and it mostly sat on a bookshelf for several years. I tried to move files off of it at some point in 2017 and thought it had failed. Forgot about it until today (Feb 2018) when, after a few tries and a different USB cable, I was able to get it to mount and transfer everything to a new drive. Then I tried to wipe/reformat it, but had trouble, so I think it's had its run. Can't decide how I feel... happy that it was magically revived after 5 years, but also wish it had been more consistent. Aren't there hard drives that don't fail? Ha ha.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Choi

customer_reviews.title: Small, but reliable drive.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and really easy to hook up and start using. Very portable, so great for a laptop. Got it about 6 months ago and it is still running strong. One thing to keep in mind, this is compatible with USB 3.0 and 2.0. So if you aren't getting the write speeds you were expecting, there is a good chance you are in a 2.0 port on your computer. This may not bother people who don't transfer large files, but it can save you some time if you make sure it's in the 3.0 port. Overall, I would recommend this drive. Works great for both laptops and desktops.
customer_reviews.author: BMac

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years Not Good Enough With Light Use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive 3 years ago nearly to the day. This morning I discovered it has totally failed, will not mount at all. I had been using it as a Time Machine backup on my Mac Mini. I used Time Machine Editor to only back up once every 48 hours. I rarely use this desktop computer since I got an iPhone. I think this drive should have lasted far longer. It was my last WD purchase. I'll award it 2 stars for lasting 3 years. From now on its going to be Seagate or Samsung; probably time to move to SSD anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Just a consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Using it to backup my computer, the included software is great to automatically back up the data you want. It lets you choose by file type which is nice. The WD software does not backup the actual operating system. So if you want to have a clone of your internal HD you would need to use a different backup method, but the physical hard drive would work fine. It is a very small enclosure powered over USB which is great. I couldn't believe how much smaller it was then my old enclosure. USB 3 of course is fast and the new standard, for the added price it's well worth it for such a great feature that directly effects usability.
customer_reviews.author: William J.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of a clicking noise if you purchase a passport or any WD drive, they have a "typical" life and do wear out.
customer_reviews.text: This started to click then died two weeks past warranty date. WD said they would replace it but not recover the data, come to discover that costs $250 to assess and hundreds more to perform data recovery... I lost Everything. Experts later told me the smaller the drive and the more data on it the more fragile it is. WD has a rep for failing, look at YouTube for how to repair a passport.... Have been advised to seek alternatives, But, if you must, Please, at the first sign of a click noise please copy it to something else before it dies. And get it serviced asap.
customer_reviews.author: Gertrude in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Quick Customer Service and They Honor Their Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I use several WD Passport drive - they all perform perfectly as multiple back-ups for the inevitable hard drive failure. Sure enough, after nearly 2 years of service, this drive failed. I called Western Digital customer service who walked me through a quick disk utility diagnostic. They confirmed the drive had failed under warranty, emailed me a return authorization label and shipping instructions for replacement. A few days later, the replacement drive arrived. Quick, friendly and no-nonsense customer service. A company who honors their warranty and takes care of the customer. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DC Jakel

customer_reviews.title: Useless due to unlock feature that can't be removed.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! Wester Digital includes a disk unlocker which can not be disabled or removed. It is not only very frustrating but it makes it impossible to use the drive on Android devices. Just very poor software, they could have easily provided an option to allow you to remove the security partition but instead (with all to common programer arrogance) made impossible to remove. Last WD product I will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: bnilsson

customer_reviews.title: good portable storage, just don't drop it
customer_reviews.text: had one that I carried with me on a motorcycle for 10k miles that I used for store backup worked flawlessly. coworker dropped it from about 18 inches, ended up losing some data. I was able to retrieve most data. ended up replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: T-Man

customer_reviews.title: Never really worked on a new MacBook Pro for some reason... then died right after the warranty expired.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drive for my mother to use for her Time Machine backups on her Macbook Pro. Unfortunately I was only able to get it to do a full backup once. It was slow and countless times my mother would call me to ask for help just keeping her backup up-to-date. It seemed strange to me as I have a newer version and it just works flawlessly. Anyway a few months after the 2-year warranty was up it started clicking (a telltale sign that the hard drive is failing). Now her laptop won't recognize it. We should have returned it when we first realized it was problematic. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Supagruv

customer_reviews.title: Didn't recognize by my computer.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this almost 5 years ago, I have barley used, I only used for back up my mac. I had only used no more than 4 times after 4 times used it then I couldn't use it because not recognize by my mac. Good thing is I still have my stuff. I would order different brand next time. Also I bought 3 times same brand not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Zenith

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Not only did the drive fail for no reason (it just stopped getting recognized by the computer - I was using it with Apple's Time Machine backup service so it wasn't being moved around or even unplugged from the computer), but going through Western Digital's RMA process was painful. Was unable to do an advanced replacement via the web using my credit card as the billing address did not match the shipping address (of course this was not a problem for the purchase of the drive). This lousy experience definitely motivates me against purchasing WD in the future.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Like most WD products it worked great for a while
customer_reviews.text: Like most WD products it worked great for a while, but then for some unknown reason, after a bit, the computer no longer recognizes it when it is plugged in. You have to constantly try to wiggle the cable and god forbid if you move your laptop just a little while its plugged in, it disconnects. Very annoying. And this is not the first WD HD to do this to me. I thought the first one maybe had a glitch, so I purchased this one but got the same problem. -.-
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Compact and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have been nothing but pleased with this external hard drive. I've recommended this external hard drive to my friends and family as it is a good small size, and better to have multiple backups than to lose your precious data. Also, this is the perfect size to take my videos on the go!
customer_reviews.author: pavan

customer_reviews.title: I use one of these with my WD TV live plus and it reads it like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about these WD portable hard drives. I own probably 6 of them. They last and last, they never fail and I carry them with me everywhere to keep my photos, documents and especially my video content with me everywhere I go! I use one of these with my WD TV live plus and it reads it like a champ. I use one to stream content to my iPad and iPhone via a RAV power file hub and it works like a champ. I always have one of these with me everywhere I go and use them for back ups of my important files at home. Love WD products! Great customer service as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kate MahoneyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: 1TB Portable External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I needed this after my laptop got a virus. I was in one of those please be able to save all my pictures needs and the computer tech I took my computer to recommended that I get this product for him to save my pictures on. Yeah I have over 10,000 pictures saved to my laptop and it was able to hold all of them and I still have room left over. Yeah, yeah, yeah! Not to mention that it is small and easy to carry around. I really like that it is easy to navigate through on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Cuppycakes808

customer_reviews.title: This stopped working after very little use and a few years.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to back up a bunch of old home movies. It has been a few years, and I decided to back everything from this hard drive to another so I have 2 back ups. Now, it will not allow me to copy the files off of the hard drive. WD support has been 0 help. They basically told me that I should pay one of their contract companies to get the files off. I would never buy another hard drive from this company ever again.
customer_reviews.author: S.H

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, con't.
customer_reviews.text: I've got a few of these as backups to our main desktop computer hard drive. To start with, I have plugged it in and just let it boot up with the main computer for a few months to check for any failures, before really loading it up with vital data. Most of the failures I've seen reported (but have never suffered first-hand) appear to be mechanical, not electronic, Users have blamed failure of support bearing or other axle structure around the spinning drive. So I figure a prolonged amount of time sitting there spinning will be a good shakedown. No problems. Tested with WD's diagnostic software on a standard file set I use on a new external HD.
customer_reviews.author: P. Corson

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's small, yes it can get warm if you're backing up a lot of stuff. I'm back and forth on the length of the USB cable. There are times when it's just too short if I'm using it with my desktop, but then it's a bit long if I'm using it with my laptop. Maybe it should have come with 2 cables in different lengths? It's quiet, love that and it includes WD diagnostics software - which is the first thing I ran. I have not used any of the other included software. I just want a simple plug it in and copy over whatever files I want to back up. And that works fine with Win7Pro 32bit.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Faulty documentation
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a robust hard drive, but the documentation is unclear. Built-in encryption makes the drive useless in certain circumstances. Before upgrading my internal hard drive I made an image of the internal one on the WD external HD. When I attempted to transfer data into the new HD, the program would not recognize the external hard drive, because of the WD encryption. This limitation is not explained in the documentation. I called WD tech support, and was told the only way to disable the encryption is to re-format the drive -- which, of course, would wipe out all the data I'd transferred to it. So the drive was useless for the purpose I intended.
customer_reviews.author: FiDiGuy

customer_reviews.title: Avoid WD My passport
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad experience with this portable drive. This is not a good back up drive if you are a super busy person. In fairness it is very quick but software developed for this hard drive is just plain cheap. It doesn't even tell you if your back up is successful. It also does not give you a chance to review your back up preferences until after you already did your back up. You end up checking some files to really know it works. It also want you to subscribe (with a fee) to a professional version that I cannot understand (All I wanted is to back up and maybe on emergency restore my files).
customer_reviews.author: SouthOfManila

customer_reviews.title: Faulty design, not enough power.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive two years ago and used it maybe twice up until my most recent road trip. It took forever to load the data onto it form my desktop (a very powerful machine with USB 3.0). When I tried copying the data onto my laptop it gave me ridiculous times (4 hours to copy 1 GB, it would transfer as slowly as 400 kb/s, cloud storage would download faster). I did some research and it appears that the design is faulty, the USB cable does not supply the drive with enough power to perform adequately. I've been buying western digital internal drives for years now, this is the last WD product I will ever purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kriti

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my laptops HD was just about full. Now everything is on here, which is perfect because shortly after my laptop's charging port broke. It does exactly what it's supposed to do. I don't carry it around or anything, but I like how small it is. It does have some other software features I don't personally use, but think they are good to have. Pros: Small physical size Can set password for security A couple cool features included USB 3.0 compatibility Cons: Can notice the humming it makes when used at times A couple features I feel are not needed, but it's personal opinion
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: worst drive ever
customer_reviews.text: this is the first review i've ever made and I'm just making it to warn others. plugged it in and began transferring files. after about 200gb transferred, it froze and I couldn't eject using the eject device option. from then on the drive would freeze windows explorer every time i tried to copy files to or from the drive. it froze explorer on multiple computers which confirmed it was the drive. seems i wasn't the only one with this problem. do a google search on "wd freeze explorer" and you will find the misery this drive has caused. i decided to return for refund, not replacement.
customer_reviews.author: broadway10001

customer_reviews.title: Great portable Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy drive. I have used these or similar drives when traveling, though the new "slim" drives from Seagate and "air" drives from WD are thinner and lighter. Currently this drive (and 2nd copy for backup) is where my wife keeps her photos. The drive in the Macbook is SSD and not very large. This handy drive provides the needed storage for her pictures. Unlike the Seagate Go Flex (which does not come in 2 TB size), this drive only has a USB 3.0 interface. The interface on the Seagate Go Flex can be changed to FireWire or Thunderbolt.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fisher

customer_reviews.title: WD will not honor their warenty
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this to warn prospective WD customers that Western Digital will not honor their warranty for this and similar product when the warranty is within six months of expiring. While the specific product that they refused to honor the warranty for was a little brother to this one, their excuse for avoiding their legal obligations was that it had been "tampered with", which was a bold faced lie. WD is clearly using the "Product was Tampered With" proviso in their warranty as a loop hole to negate their warranty while claiming they still have one. While they make good products just remember that the Company itself is unscrupulous.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this just to backup my media library, and was very impressed with its performance. I also liked not having a need for an external power supply since it gets its power directly from the USB port. It is backwards compatible with USB 2.0 but when hooked to a USB 3.0 port its surprisingly fast. Another unadvertised bonus was that the drive seems to be highly compatible with every smart TV I have plugged it into and was able to play my movies directly from the drive (after the TV finished indexing the media library on the drive) . Over all I have to say this is the best external hard drive I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.text: I trust Western Digital. It's my favorite brand for hard drives. This Passport is amazing. I've been using it for years now and it works perfectly. As long as you keep it in a safe place it will last for many years. The quality is great and I couldn't ask for a better external hard drive. So much space to put my things on!! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: lah3x

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I really like my Passport. I've been using it for a couple of years now and it performs very well. It loads up quickly on my MacBook and it plays well with Time Machine. It's compact, light, and a very pretty blue. Since it's USB-powered, there's no need to deal with an annoying cord. My mom has this same Passport, as well, and she has been unable to change the hard drive's password (I helped her and did everything I could think of). Not exactly problematic, but kind of a pain. Mine, I've changed the password without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Alena D.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a viable way to back up your data securely you have found the right product. Although it comes with a high price tag, this external hard drive can and will back up hundreds of gigs worth of data in a relatively short period of time. However the required software that comes with it is very much lacking. I have had many problems with it and only after recent updates have they fixed some major problems. Overall I would recommend it to anyone who wants to store data for long periods of time. Transferring files on the other hand will cause problems due to the product's inferior software.
customer_reviews.author: Renee A.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this hard drive to store my family photos, including full hd videos of our baby. The manufacturing quality is very good and it transfer files very fast if used with a USB 3.0 connection. It is a bit sturdier but I think its good as it offers better protection for the internal drive. One thing I did not like is that the capacity is advertised as 2.0 TB but the real one is around 1.84 TB. I still consider this is not enough to diminish the rating as it is a very common (but bad) marketing practice. I definitely recommend this drive to anybody who wants to increase size and speed with quality and without compromise.
customer_reviews.author: will824

customer_reviews.title: Proprietary software limits usability
customer_reviews.text: Hard drive works OK. Proprietary backup management software is intrusive and does not seem to be able to be worked around. The interface is nice to use, but I don't like using it. One of the WD Smartware exe files would continue to load into memory on my Toshiba Satellite and slow the computer to an unusable crawl if I did not have the external drive connected. Seemed to be continually searching for something. I had to disable through process management. I will not buy another WD Smartware drive again.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Lunt

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is perfect for the first time user who knows nothing about portable hard drives. Remember that you do not have to install ANY of the software that comes with the drive. This unit is a simple "plug an play" device that works well through your Windows Explorer. 2TB is more room than the average user will need in a lifetime!! Backup storage for all of your files at this price is amazing. You can carry it all with you and hook up to any other computer to share any of your data. This is a well made, easy to use piece of equipment that I would recommend to anyone that is lookibg for an external storage device.
customer_reviews.author: Dent Cermak

customer_reviews.title: WD My Passport 1 TB Ex HD
customer_reviews.text: This works well for me. Easy to install. Easy to set up, but you do need to read the digital help manuals. I've had this for mare than a year. Have used it to restore damaged individual files. (Never had a need for a complete HD restore). Does seem to slow some CPU actions during periodic update functions, but it's not a big issue. I do like the idea of being continuously backed up. If I am ever working on something so sensitive I don't want it on the back up, I just unplug the USB cable. Later, after scrubbing the machine HD, I re-connect the Passport and off it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Savy Grandpa Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any issues with this drive. I purchased two. I transferred over 1.5TB in a day with no issues. I do use the WD Smartware software to do diagnostics. I think this will help the drive. I believe it is there for a reason. The only strange thing is when I chose to defrag from Windows 7, the drive does not show up. I am assuming WD wants you to use its software. The complete diagnostic can take from a day to 12 hours depending drive. I hae gotten some fast transfer speeds but that was with USB 2.0.
customer_reviews.author: wilric44

customer_reviews.title: Best portable I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I store ALL of my television shows and movies on this after converting them to mp4. They play back perfectly on SmartTVs with USB ports and even through a Roku with a USB port. The key is that when converting your videos into mp4, in Audio make sure that you select "44 mHz" instead of 48 or anything else AND you select "2 channel" (stereo) instead of 6 or anything else. When converting for this GREAT portable drive, I convert into the highest h264 Video settings and 192 on the Audio. And the best converting software to use for this purpose, putting them on this portable USB drive is the "Aimersoft Video Convert". [...]
customer_reviews.author: The BanjoNut

customer_reviews.title: By far the best WD I will ever own
customer_reviews.text: For a WD product, this one is by far the best one I have every owned and this is to say that it has yet to fail! Every one, I didn't learn with one and two, but when two quit or died as number one, I had already bought number three, this one. It has outlasted the other two by two years, it is encased in a hard shell, quality materials and its responsiveness is refreshing. It arrived on time, as described by Amazon & manufacturer, it was shipped on time, arrived within prescribed estimates, the packaging was undamaged, and the product itself was unmolested and made with quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: 007Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Good portable storage
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn't like more gigabyte storage these days? Step into the terabyte world and storage space really opens up. A while back, I bought and downloaded software online to burn my dvds to backup storage. This 1TB Passport from Western Digital was my choice to store the dvds I convert. A quality product, it works well, has built-in security that's EZ to use, no heat issues, and is relatively durable. It works using more commom 2.0 USBs as well as 3.0. I'm sure there's the odd unit that has problems out of the package, but Western Digital has earned a good reputation through the years for reliable storage devices, hard drives, etc.
customer_reviews.author: lawdog

customer_reviews.title: So far so good- 3 months working like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This drive has been perfect for backing up my 1TB macbook pro with Time machine. Some folks at macrumors gave me the good advice to save a few bucks and buy this version instead of the "my passport for mac" version. Depending on what you're using it for- you may not need the extra software. I bought the other one by mistake and quickly exchanged for this one. Easy to set up with mac time machine and I've never had any trouble with it. I've had the best luck with Western Digital drives and I have used Iomega, Maxtor and Sandisk all of which had had far more problems and "unexpected deaths" than WD.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Lucia

customer_reviews.title: Best portable HDs
customer_reviews.text: If you (a) travel a lot between different computers, (b) want to minimize the risk of losing data to hackers or viruses who screw up your hard drive so reformatting it is your only cost-effective option, and (c) know that cloud computing's reliability depends on the humor of the investors who control the servers, then (d) you'll want to use external hard drives as your principal data storage locations with backup elsewhere. That's what I've been doing for years. Western Digital drives have never failed me, while Iomega drives have prove much less reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flash Drives Do Not Back Up
customer_reviews.text: The software is easy to use, although I am still trying to figure out the software updates. It keeps telling me to update, then that no updates are available..... It may be user error. It is small and easy to use. I really like the little rubber feet that keep it still and quiet. My only serious complaint is that it does not automatically backup flash drives (removable storage) that are attached to the computer. It seems I have to back the flash drives up to my laptop hard drive, then back up the hard drive. It works, but is a bit annoying, given the price. I've had other external drives in the past that could handle this simple task.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for two years, then...
customer_reviews.text: It died. I used this as on a Macbook Pro as the Time Machine backup device. Perhaps its lifetime was reduced by being more or less continuously attached to my laptop. But it abruptly stopped working after a bit more than two years of use, and my backups are now lost. I've connected it to multiple computers, and to separately powered usb connectors, but the computers no longer "see" it as a storage device so it appears that the electronics have died.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Baird

customer_reviews.title: Great External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I researched external hard drives before deciding on this one. It is a great addition to my PC. You just plug it in & before you know it, your files, pictures & anything else you want to save is backed up. Recently my PC crashed & the repairman had difficulty restoring my most treasured documents & pictures. That is why I decided to get an external hard drive. Now if my computer crashes again, I will be able to restore my documents & pictures without problems. I was advised not to leave it plugged in at all times as the hard drive instuctions suggested. I just plug it in to backup, then unplug for safety & security.
customer_reviews.author: Casino Girl

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital personal storage devices are the best choice.
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these Western Digital 1TB external drives, one for daily use which hold all my data and the others for backup. I don't believe in uploading my data to the Cloud. After working for one of these 'cloud' companies for 14 years I can say that your data is not safe and is not secure from invasion of privacy. Whatever your reasons are for external storage, Western Digital personal storage devices are the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: It works, good price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister to use while out of the country for a few years. I chose this one because of its small size, price, and the fact that WD is a major HD manufacturer. It has worked out fine, and the USB 3.0 is pretty fast. She mainly uses it to store movies and TV shows that she cannot get in whatever terrible place she finds herself in at the moment. It is also plenty small enough to fit in your carry-on luggage, so you don't have to worry as much about it disappearing in your checked luggage. I recommend it, and you can buy a carrying case for it separately.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great portable data storage solution
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little 1 TB external storage devise. I bought this to use as back-up storage for my movies, music, photos, and documents. It requires only one USB cord for its power and communication, transmits data fast, runs silently, and error free. It can be used with or without its included security and computer back-up software. Both my Windows and Linux operating systems recognize it instantly plug-and-play and install its operating drivers automatically and seamlessly. I've been using it problem free daily now for over a month, and it's already about half full of data.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Koscinch

customer_reviews.title: I love mine!
customer_reviews.text: I love how small and compact this thing is, it fits in the palm of my hand. I also got the protective case too which can hold the Passport AND it's mini cord that comes with it. It works great, stores data very quickly, and holds up well. I've had it for just over one year, and so far so good. I have had zero issues with it. Runs great, and I hope it keeps going! Update, April 2015: My hard drive still works wonderfully. I plug it in and update my info on it every couple of months and not once have I had any glitches or issues!! Still a great purchase and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Katie ATop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. One concern?
customer_reviews.text: I had a 1TB WD Passport that kicked the bucket and made life a real hassle, but I decided to give it another ago with the 2TB drive. It's much more solid, has a much nicer design, and hasn't given me any problems (yet). I DO have one concern... after I 'stop' this drive so it can be safely removed, and Windows lets me know it's safe to remove it, the drive still spins indefinitely until I unplug it. This strikes me as potentially dangerous if the drive is writing or reading. However, I admit that I don't know much about this tech, so maybe this feature is intended. Leave a comment if you know so I can stop worrying...
customer_reviews.author: danno

customer_reviews.title: Big & Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Owned since: Summer of 2012 Thankfully I purchased this before my previous passport died. The Good: -Large amount of memory -FAST data transfer -Great travel size The Bad: -nothing yet This product has been working great since the day I got it (hopefully FOREVER). The only thing I'm afraid of is my last passport was a 750GB WD. Since this is the same brand, I'm just afraid it might have the bad genes of it's younger brother (but hopefully not). Aside from my fear of the past repeating itself, this is a great travel sized hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Electronic ShinobiTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Mislabeled packaging
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive came in beat up, but probably original packaging. I purchased a 1 TB drive and received a 500 GB drive. Packaging printing indicated a 500 GB drive (correct) but box had a sticker on it indicating that the package actually contained a 1 TB drive (what I ordered and paid for). Between the beat up packaging and the sticker, I have my suspicions that something isn't quite 100% here, and this might be a "gray market" device. It also could be completely innocent. At any rate Amazon is replacing it, no questions. For what its worth, the drive, included USB cord, and instructions/warranty sheet all look like they are new.
customer_reviews.author: Mads Dad

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work with OSX formatting for those looking to Time Machine. Also doesn't work in old machines very well because of proprietary software crap on drive. I tried everything in the world to remove that old proprietary crap and even though it's gone the drive still searches for it when you plug it in. Causing it to be fairly incompatible with older hardware or just take forever to install because it has to fail on the first weird software driver before trying the next. Time will tell how this drive holds up, it's getting the job done but I don't have high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Austin

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Performance
customer_reviews.text: It worked for one day. Then after that the connection started just dropping off of my laptop at random and for no apparent reason. I couldn't transfer anything on or off the device. I looked at online forums for help and it appears to be a very common problem with no clear solution. I had the IT manager at my office try the device on a variety of laptop and desktops to see if it was my laptop, but it did the same thing. I called WD and they sent me a new cable, which arrived today, but doesn't make a difference. I'm definitely returning this product and trying a new brand for hopefully more reliable performance.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly Warne

customer_reviews.title: Great Product from WD
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these from Wal-Mart several months back for a client who needed more storage for movies and music. After he told me how great it was, I tried this one again with a recent client and, again, found that it was perfect. Both times it worked straight out of the box with both MAC and PC. The USB 3.0 port is an exceptional increase in speed both reading and writing. The compact design fits well in a protective case I found here on amazon. The drive is quiet. I wasn't even able to tell it was spinning when I plugged it in. Overall, a great drive and a great price here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: chughe17

customer_reviews.title: WD My Passport 1TB Portable External Hard Drive Storage USB 3.0 Black
customer_reviews.text: An EXCELLENT 1TB portable hard drive. Very easy to use, was able to transfer files quickly and error free from 2 desktops and 3 laptops without an issue or problem. When used with a USB 3.0 port, the transfer rates are very fast and reliable. The hard drive casing is attractive and durable, with tiny rubber bumps on the bottom, that prevents it from sliding all over your table. The USB 3.0 connection is a reassuringly tight fit. If there was one area that I think could be improved on, is to make the USB 3.0 cable a little longer. Overall, an EXCELLENT buy, and I am VERY happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DaL

customer_reviews.title: Great for MAC
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well with MAC and the Time Machine utility. Purchased one of the new Retina MacBook Pro's recently, and there was a problem with the display, so Apple swapped the defective unit out for a new one. Since I had the old machine (1 month old) backed up on the Passport using Apples Time Machine, I was back in business within 15 minutes, as the Passport restored all the files to the new machine. Hard to believe, but true. Apple charges $99 for transferring files to a new machine -- that's about the cost of this Passport, and the process was effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Goldrush

customer_reviews.title: Great size and functionality
customer_reviews.text: I've really enjoyed being able to carry this in my laptop bag every where I go and it's easy to plug it in and throw your files on quickly. I only have usb 2.0 and I was worried about transfer speeds but it is fast enough for me. Even my first massive transfer didn't take as long as I thought it would. This drive is smaller than I figured it would be and is quiet. I was worried about a smaller drive generating too much heat but it stays cool throughout the transfer. So far it has been great! I also just transfer manually instead of using a program and it's fairly straight forward and simple.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleA

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage
customer_reviews.text: First of all this is way over-priced for the storage capacity. There are 2TB drives for $80 here on amazon that have shock protection and are waterproof.. WD tech support is virtually non-existent and the quality of the physical drive itself is garbage. It comes in a cheap plastic shell with a poor quality cable. I dropped this thing from barely 3 feet off the ground and now my computer can't recognize it. If this was the only option I'd understand but there are literally dozens of better options on amazon alone.
customer_reviews.author: Tal Kliger

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: this HD is much slimmer than the 2TB WD I have. Firstly, It feels thin too thin actually, when you put it on a surface it doesn't not hold (It doesn't have those rubber things that the old one have to prevent it from sliding). Secondly, when you attach the cable it feels loose and not secure. Thirdly, it worked for 10 minutes and then died, Not readable and not formatable. The only good thing out of the experience was amazon customer service. Amazing as usual. Resent another one and asked me to return it within 30 days. No question asked. I love Amazon. I did not love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amr A. Eid

customer_reviews.title: Inexplicable failure
customer_reviews.text: Crashed with little use. It's been sitting on my shelf out of use for about 4 months. I connected it to my computer to back up some additional files, and it came up in explorer no problem. I proceed to start copying files, and then I started hearing a grinding sound, and then it crashed explorer, had to restart my computer, and it no longer is visible in explorer (upon boot-up), and it just makes grinding noises when I plug it in. I've tried multiple usb cables (and successfully connected my other Toshiba external hard drive with no problem). I'm really careful with my devices - this is just product failure... disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SylvanVerde

customer_reviews.title: Vast Amount of Unlimited Space!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking I might need more space, but this is like a never ending black hole! I was able to store the entire contents of my computer, two-years worth of scanned receipts, the entire content of my google drive that has my saved school work spanning from high school to college (I'm a very organized person), medical records, etc. and it still has 1.89TB of space! Wow! It was also very easy to convert it from pc to mac (p.s. one of the customer reviews here has a step-by-step process to help you with this) that I was able to use it with my mac right away!
customer_reviews.author: colormeviolet

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Good IGNORE BAD REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: I see the bad reviews about faulty units. Replace them. Simple. I've bought six of these 2TB units and at least 20 WD External Hard Drives over the years: 1. You plug in the USB port. 2. Wait 10 seconds as it self installs 3. Start copying and pasting data I know next to NOTHING about computers, I just know what works. Personally, never had one fail. Your mileage may vary. 2TB? Self Powered? Grab and Go? USB 3.0 Speeds? For this price? Winner Winner Chicken Dinner! Trust this non-expert. They are great. BACK YOUR DATA UP FIRST OF EACH MONTH
customer_reviews.author: Mike90125

customer_reviews.title: just a regular use I hate WD drives
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, after I plug it in my xbox as I've used to do to get my music and videos but that time it won't recognize. the I get hurry to put it in my computer but it won't work. It just causing a noise and won't get recognized by file manager I know that's somethign wrong but I've called a computer experience and he told me that it was ruined and crashed It didn't dropped or something, just a regular use I hate WD drives, I've lost about 4 of them the same way
customer_reviews.author: Mahmud Ali Elmasri

customer_reviews.title: After the warranty period is over, it dropped dead!
customer_reviews.text: After the warranty period is over, it dropped dead! The disk is not even recognizable for the computer. It has been used used as a backup disk, and sitting on desk. Never been carried around, and never had any bumping. It just seized to read last month. ALl my data on that disk is lost! For modern day HD, it should have last much longer than 2+ years!
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: Fast and spacious
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact, spacious drive, perhaps a bit expensive at present compared to a 1.5TB size, but very to have. On initially attaching this to a notebook computer through a USB 3.0 card (rather than a built-in USB port), the drive kept going on and off. Disappointed (since I had already attached it to a desk top with no issue, including upgrading the firmware), I decided to call customer service. I was shocked at how good it was: the technician diagnosed the problem immediately, which was that the USB card in my notebook was not snuggly inserted. Once done, voila! Works like a charm. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur Sachs

customer_reviews.title: 140 kb/s with USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: I have had this EHD for a few years now, bought it straight from Western Digital. I barely grace 140 kb/s on my laptop (which is understandable if my laptop was 6+ years old. It's two years old (I believe younger than this product). It's pretty sad when my flash drive transfers files quicker, both with USB 3.0. Cheers though - if it works for you, hooray! Off to gather a new External Hard Drive.
customer_reviews.author: Charles McGee

customer_reviews.title: No spin up time.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't notice this feature until I got a Toshiba drive. This always stay spinning, it doesn't shut down after inactivity. Its a really nice feature to have no matter what you use it for. If you're using this to augment your storage you can access your data right away, my other drive takes a minute to spin up. If this is for a all ways connected back up sometimes my back up program wont recognize the other drive because it takes so long to respond this, runs perfectly all the time. I'm sure they think this is good feature for laptop users to save power but its an annoyance in desktops.
customer_reviews.author: bookmonkey786

customer_reviews.title: Very compact, reliable so far, like colors!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional photographer and use several of these for various categories of my business and for backup. For each category I am backing up, silver is the main drive and I back that up to a black drive daily. Every week I backup to a red drive that goes to a fireproof safe. Where as it would be easy to get mixed up just using labeled drives. the colors make it obvious which back up is which. I use a laptop computer rather than a desktop and the size of these drives make them very easy to take along. I put them in the Amazon cases designed for these drives.
customer_reviews.author: Kodachrome man

customer_reviews.title: Excellent external drive
customer_reviews.text: Great backup software and hard drive. It just works ... No install issues. Bought a second one for my wife's machine. Have a NAS unit (Synology) that is supposed to be the great solution, but I find it to be less reliable. Backup on this happens incrementally in the background - no visible performance impact. Recovered a couple files just to test and see if it worked - no issues. Fairly intuitive interface compared to other solutions in the past. Using it on a 2.0 USB port. Very please with this.
customer_reviews.author: Zip

customer_reviews.title: I love this little gizmo.
customer_reviews.text: My aging PC's 80GB hard drive was being eaten up, and slowed down, by my music collection, so I decided to get this drive and transfer my music onto it, and thus free up more of my internal hard drive. This little drive has filled the bill marvelously, My computer now runs as fast as when it was new, and I'm able to access my music files directly from the external hard drive. I've also used it to store a complete back-up of my internal hard drive, just in case, and I still have masses of space available. Great solution!
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Utter trash
customer_reviews.text: This drive - the second WD I have owned, just died after 14 months. The first one I knocked over, and it still worked for a while, but died a few days later. So I figured that could be my fault, and bought this portable model. If it is designed to travel in a laptop bag and get jolted around, it should be plenty durable to sit still on a desktop. It has never been dropped, overheated, damaged in any way, and the thing still died while I was watching a movie. Done with WD products.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Green Jeans

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for always have my files with me.
customer_reviews.text: Our school district has blocked all cloud storage applications, so I needed new a way to keep my files in sync on multiple home computers and have access to those files at work. This has worked well for me for a year now. I used Microsoft's Briefcase to sync it my desktop computer and OneDrive to sync that with my laptop. It's not as easy as using OneDrive (previously SkyDrive) or Dropbox, but it works and there's more than enough space to store all video clips and music files in addition to documents that I could possibly need while at work.
customer_reviews.author: Hedi A. Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Less Than Useful
customer_reviews.text: this is my third or fourth external hard drive, like the idea, esp. in the larger sizes, used mainly for backup so it can be removed from the computer and not subject to internal hard drive problems; most come with a "plug-n-play" type menu, it starts loading and presents a menu of choices and sometime suggestions; this just started copying and did nothing else; after talking to WD a couple of times if copies fine but there is no way to access it ... still; I'd give this one a pass, or maybe WD a pass
customer_reviews.author: MacGeezer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive was purchased to be connected to a laptop using an SLR camera to timelapse a multi-month construction project. We're about a month in, and it's still working. Additionally I have a second copy of this drive grabbing footage from a replay for some hockey games and taking it to the editing shop off-site. It's fast enough to work with one stream of 1080i footage, but it's the slowest drive I use for video. The build is a fairly well formed plastic case, but it's a standard Western Digital build. Don't ask the world of it and it won't disappoint, but it's no G-Drive Mini.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nearly a year ago to store movies, music, photos, on for when I moved to Costa Rica. The humidity is crazy high here and the air is caustic with a salty breeze, but despite living on the ocean and next to the jungle (across the road), this hard drive has worked like a charm. It's smaller than I expected (which is good!) and it has a tough outer case. It's fast when transferring large files, and the 2T size is just right for my needs. I've lived here for 7 months in this muggy, salty environment, and so far, so good. Knock on wood...
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good I Would Advise
customer_reviews.text: Well I think mines the same had it for under a month unless it is just for back up I found drag and drop works best all the bloatware that comes with it is going to leave a larger foot print and there are more places for it to foul up ,I had another before . This way I can drag full folders really pretty fast in my 2.0 USBB and it is a portable so no stress about ruining my friends Computer with something I attached ,I leave everything I can off just a plug and play that only needs a USB cord (the mini end is different but ok just never lose it Have good files rsdno
customer_reviews.author: rsdno

customer_reviews.title: very handy but... (updated
customer_reviews.text: I don't carry my HDs around. So portability is not high on my list. But I love this HD because it does not need a power code. Also, USB3.0 is very, very fast. (Update) I liked it for a while. But it started having a problem. My laptop started failing to recognize the drive. As it turned out, the USB port (the drive side) is very flimsy, and the connection becomes very unstable with even a slight movement/shock. If you tweak the cable and hit a right spot, is works. But it is unstable. I really liked this product. But I may have to find an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: MSPDX97214

customer_reviews.title: Good product, no problems
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to format (Windows 7) Good performance No problems Looks good Sturdy case Cons: None so far Nicely designed, good performing HDD. Have bought several, five from Amazon, one from local retailer, and own six in total. Four are 1 TB versions and two are 2TB versions of this product and I have various colors, incl, black, red, blue and silver. All six have worked well with the three Windows 7 machines I have at home. Use them for backups and to archive photos, videos and music. No complaints yet: great products after 6-12 months.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Great device!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the previous generation passport for years and it's saved my bacon on more occasions than I care to mention since I dump everything on it in case of computer crashes. I decided to treat myself to another one for my art files and was stunned at the difference in size! With a new computer and USB 3 option, this is a rocket ship when it comes to downloading large files (which art files tend to be). And it still works on my old computer with only USB 2 ports. I bought a hard case for it in the same order and love it. I highly recommend the Western Digital Passport no matter what size you get.
customer_reviews.author: MLS

customer_reviews.title: Old PC to New PC
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a new PC and needed to back up a lot of important information. Of course, I couldn't find my old external HD after my recent move. So I hoped on Amazon Mobile, searched for what I wanted and was amazed. My old WD was almost twice the price and half the storage space. So, of course I was happy to jump on this deal. It showed up quickly due to my Prime membership. Immediately put it to work with all of my file exchange from old to new. Has been working like a champ and am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Great back up
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this drive to backup my Western Digital "My Book" external hard drive. I was going to subscribe to a cloud service, but the cost, time it takes to back up files to the cloud and the fact the NSA has copied all the cloud files made my decision to back things up to another hard rive. This is really nice - I back up each week and put the drive in my fireproof safe. I scanned all my important documents, old slides, photos as well as current documents and then backed up on this drive. I have had good luck with Western Digital and hope this drive will give me years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Lasts 6-7 Years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive in 2012 and it died this past month, so figure on 6-7 years of life. I have other drives that have lasted much longer and some not as long, so the 3/5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external drive as a gift for my sister who, for some reason, has to restore her laptop and lose her pictures and such. We plugged it in, let it setup and copied files to it without any headaches. We didn't read any of the included paperwork or find it necessary to search online on how to operate it. It just worked! I've liked Western Digital products since the early days of pc's and the quality is the same has it was back then. While I'd get a terabyte for myself, 500 gigs is plenty for my people. I recommend this external drive.
customer_reviews.author: The Tall Paul

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with all operating systems
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this ZERO stars I would. This drive is not compatible with MacBooks. I bought this drive as a backup for my computer. Over the years I've been saving data and other information on this drive and now it doesn't work when plugged into the computer. I've tried it on multiple computers and it will not work. Now all my files are gone and since the serial number is not visible I'm not able to get a replacement. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Works Well So Far
customer_reviews.text: The WD Passport seems great so far. The included backup software does what it says - automatically backs up any new files from your computer to the external hard drive. It is small so it takes up very little room on my desk. I have not had to restore anything yet, but I have searched the drive to be sure it is backing up my files (which, as I said, it is). So, I presume that restoring things will be easy if needed. I use mine on Windows 7 Home Premium and it works smoothly. I recommend it and will update this review if there are any new developments.
customer_reviews.author: Sail Away

It features ultra-fast USB 3.0 connectivity; compatibility with USB 2.0; automatic, backup software; and password protection and hardware encryption to help protect your files from unauthorized use.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



MY PASSPORT PORTABLE HARD DRIVE – MINI DRIVE. MEGA CAPACITY. MULTI COLORS. 
My Passport offers high capacity in a sleek portable drive. It features ultra-fast USB 3.0 connectivity; automatic, backup software; and password protection and hardware encryption to help protect your files from unauthorized use with plenty of room to store all your files.






Automatic backup
WD's automatic, continuous backup software works quietly in the background to help protect your data using minimal PC resources. Whenever you add or change a file, it's instantly backed up.





High capacity, sleek design 
Offering high capacity in a compact drive, My Passport is the ideal companion for anyone with lots of videos, photos, music, and files that they want to help protect and take on the road.





Password protection secures your drive
Use WD Security to set password protection and hardware encryption and protect your files from unauthorized use or access.









ULTRA-FAST TRANSFER RATES
- When connected to a USB 3.0 port, My Passport lets you access and save files in blazing speed. Reduce transfer time by up to 3 times when compared to USB 2.0 transfer rates.*

*Performance may vary based on user's hardware and system configuration. 

USB 3.0 AND USB 2.0 COMPATIBILITY
- With this single drive you get compatibility with your USB 2.0 devices today and the ultra-fast speed of USB 3.0 when you’re ready to step up to the next generation. 

AUTOMATIC, CONTINUOUS BACKUP SOFTWARE
- WD's automatic backup software works quietly in the background to help protect your data using minimal PC resources. Whenever you add or change a file, it’s instantly backed up. 

WD SECURITY
- WD Security utility allows you to set password protection and hardware encryption for your drive to protect your files from unauthorized use or access. 

WD DRIVE UTILITIES
- Register your drive, set drive timer, run diagnostics and more using WD Drive Utilities. 

USB-POWERED
- Powered directly from the USB port on your PC. No separate power supply is needed. 

WD QUALITY INSIDE AND OUT
- We know your data is important to you. So we build the drive inside to our demanding requirements for durability, shock tolerance, and long-term reliability. Then we protect the drive with a durable enclosure designed for style and protection. 



IDEAL FOR
 * Transferring files in blazing fast speed with USB 3.0
 * Connecting to USB 2.0 devices today and USB 3.0 devices when you're ready
 * Backing up your files with automatic, continuous backup software
 * Securing your files from unauthorized access with password protection and hardware encryption
 * Adding extra storage for your videos, music, photos, and files
 * Connecting and powering through your USB 3.0 or USB 2.0 interface



WHAT'S IN THE BOX

Portable hard drive, Automatic backup software, WD Security software, WD Drive Utilities software, USB cable, Quick Install Guide. 

COMPATIBILITY

Formatted NTFS for Windows XP, Windows Vista, or Windows 7
Requires reformatting for Mac OS X Leopard or Snow Leopard, or Lion
